 http://forums.canadiancontent.net/news/66183-stab-proof-school-uniforms-go-sale-protect-pupils-knife-attacks.html
 
 Stab-proof school uniforms go on sale to protect pupils from knife attacks
 
 14th August 2007
 Daily Mail 
 
 Stab-proof school uniforms have gone on sale for the first time in Britain, sparking a rush of inquiries from worried parents looking to protect their youngsters from knife attacks. 
 
 According to the Sun newspaper, parents are paying up to £65 a time to get their hands on the uniforms - lined with Kelvar - the material used in armoured vests worn by British troops in Iraq. 
 
 Stab-proof uniforms are being sold by Essex-based firm BladeRunner, which has already plugged a gap in the teenage market by selling Kevlar hoodies. 
 
 Kevlar is a light synthetic material which can be spun into a fabric five times stronger than steel. 
 
 BladeRunner Bosses Adrian Davis and Barry Samms already make Kevlar-lined uniforms for police and security guards but began taking requests from parents who wanted to line their children's school uniforms with the protective material. 
 
 Mr Davis said: "We've had so many calls from parents requesting the service in time for their children to go back to school, we think we'll have to set up a whole division devoted to it. 
 
 "Parents send us in blazers and we line them with Kevlar - it's discreet and no-one would know you were wearing it." 
 
 The move follows concerns from both students and parents after a spate of knife-related attacks on teenagers across the UK. 
 
 Seven boys aged under 16 have died in such attacks within two months this year alone. 
 
 Concerned mother Kimberley Starr told The Sun she supported stab-proof clothes for children following a vicious attack on her daughter Bridie outside her Bristol school. 
 
 "If she had been wearing it (Kevlar) she wouldn't have spent two weeks in hospital," she said.

You're somewhat correct here. You can hardly tell what will freak individuals out. I'm not in favor of censorship. I do favor supervision by parents of what their children are exposed to. Bad parents don't supervise much and their children watch whatever turns them on. 
 
 
 

 My aunt blames The Who for her nephew's suicide and its drives me nuts. The very idea is an insult to and trivialization of the real problems faced by the real people involved.
I don't know the circumstances surrounding your cousin's suicide, but your aunt could be right. I fail to see why this should drive you nuts. It's just her opinion.
jitobear

Here it is again...rap is more akin to chanting to jungle drums than to music.

 
 Spoken just like someone who has never given it a real listen. It is absolutely nothing like that. And whats your beef with rythem anyway? Is only melody music? 
 
 RAP IS MUSIC. Where you insult is when you imply it isn't. It may be a musical style you don't like (like how I feel about jazz) but it is music.
 
 
I'm not in favor of censorship. 

 
 Good.
 
 
I do favor supervision by parents of what their children are exposed to. Bad parents don't supervise much and their children watch whatever turns them on. 

 
 I was never much of a censor. We don't do porn or Rambo - but we don't sanitize either - and we listen to rock and rap (and are not homicidal). 
 
 
I don't know the circumstances surrounding your cousin's suicide, but your aunt could be right. I fail to see why this should drive you nuts. It's just her opinion.

 
 Not my cousin. Her nephew within her family (she is married to my mom's brother). She endorses censorship. I love the Who and am yet living.
jim's trucking

Spoken just like someone who has never given it a real listen. It is absolutely nothing like that. And whats your beef with rythem anyway? Is only melody music? 
 
 RAP IS MUSIC. Where you insult is when you imply it isn't. It may be a musical style you don't like (like how I feel about jazz) but it is music.
That I hold an opinion differing from yours regarding any issue should not be insulting to you. Perhaps if I held a low opinion of some family member or ethnic group you'd rightfully be insulted, but my opinion of what's music and what's not should not insult you. If it really does, then you're one sensitive, screwed-up being. You're insulted that I don't agree with you. Now THAT is arrogance!;) 
 
 Rhythm is not required for music. Whales make beautiful music without rhythm. Rhythm is prevelant in the music we manufacture. Certainly a drum solo or a steel-drum band utilizes rhythm. I have no 'beef' with rhythm.
 
 There's nothing wrong with using rhythm in speech either. Some of the better peotry is meant to be rhythmic.
 
 I've not heard much RAP because I choose not to waste my time with it. I'd rather listen to a computer generated voice give me repeated messages regarding the weather forecast (try NOAA Radio sometime) than listen to RAP.
 
 Perhaps you could work up a CD of RAP that you consider to be quality music and send it to me.
 
 

 
 ...
 
 
 
 I was never much of a censor. We don't do porn or Rambo - but we don't sanitize either - and we listen to rock and rap (and are not homicidal). 
 What do have against Rambo? ...porn? 
 
 I listen to rock now and then...selected pieces...Bob Seiger and others.
 
 There's a difference between censorship and protecting young innocents from the deluge of materials floating around today. There is no benefit in allowing a child to grow up too fast. The people who publish porn and violence have a right to do just that. I have a right to think they are damaging society by pushing hedonism and exaltation of violent behavior on impressionable minds that may subsequently cause their owners to be influenced to do things they shouldn't. You couple a controlling, rebelious song with some mind altering drugs and you've got yourself a time bomb. 
 
 
 

 Not my cousin. Her nephew within her family (she is married to my mom's brother). She endorses censorship. I love the Who and am yet living.
...but can you say her nephew wasn't driven by The Who to take his own life? Are you aware somehow of what was going through his mind when he killed himself? Are you good at eliminating possible causes of suicidal tendencies and actions? Just because you can handle being exposed to something doesn't mean everybody else should be able to. It certainly does not imply an impossibility.
 
 I'm not afraid of spiders. Some people are.
thecap0

jt,
 
 There's a difference between censorship and protecting young innocents from the deluge of materials floating around today. 
 
 I'll bet you would have a difficult time elucidating just what the difference IS.
 
 Be that as it may, the net effect will be to bring what adults listen to, watch, or read down to the level of children.:(

post_info.post_title: Life is too short to live it in Texas!

jim's trucking

There's a difference between censorship and protecting young innocents from the deluge of materials floating around today. 

 
 I'll bet you would have a difficult time elucidating just what the difference IS.
 
 
Quite simple. Censorship would involve prohibiting the production and publication of certain images...protecting young innocents from those materials involves controlling their access to it; something that good parents know already.
 
 
 

 Be that as it may, the net effect will be to bring what adults listen to, watch, or read down to the level of children.:(
Don't be silly.
jitobear

That I hold an opinion differing from yours regarding any issue should not be insulting to you. Perhaps if I held a low opinion of some family member or ethnic group you'd rightfully be insulted, but my opinion of what's music and what's not should not insult you. If it really does, then you're one sensitive, screwed-up being. You're insulted that I don't agree with you. Now THAT is arrogance!;) 

 
 No - its arrogant to think one's own opinion is the definition of a thing. I hate jazz - but its music. I don't like romance novels - but their still books. I have little patience for Christianity - its still a religion.
 
 
Rhythm is not required for music. Whales make beautiful music without rhythm. Rhythm is prevelant in the music we manufacture. Certainly a drum solo or a steel-drum band utilizes rhythm. I have no 'beef' with rhythm.

 
 Nor is rythem by itself not music.
 
 
I've not heard much RAP because I choose not to waste my time with it. I'd rather listen to a computer generated voice give me repeated messages regarding the weather forecast (try NOAA Radio sometime) than listen to RAP.

 
 And I have no problem with that whatsoever.
 
 
Perhaps you could work up a CD of RAP that you consider to be quality music and send it to me.

 
 Why? You don't like it. I don't want to make you like it. Its your claims that its not music and your inaccurate descriptions of what is involved in its production and sound that bug me - not the fact that you aren't a fan. 
 
 Plus, I would be a poor person to pull together a good collection for you. I like some rap but I am a rock and roll fan. My sister or my best friend would do a better job than me at putting together a rap compilation.
 
 
What do have against Rambo? ...porn? 

 
 Watching other people have sex is so not sexy and I don't find violence for violence sake (with no real context) entertaining or interesting. My son knows about these things and why I don't have them about. 
 
 
I listen to rock now and then...selected pieces...Bob Seiger and others.

 
 I listen to it all the time - and usually stuff that is harder than Bob Seager - although I like him and "southern rock" well enough.
 
 
There's a difference between censorship and protecting young innocents from the deluge of materials floating around today. There is no benefit in allowing a child to grow up too fast. 

 
 I don't know. I don't agree with subjecting a child to subject matter he or she is not yet old enough to understand. But kids are smart cookies - they catch on quick and I do not believe much in this romantic idea of "innocence". Once my son was old enough to understand it we talked about it. And when he asked questions I answered them in an age-appropriate way. I have never approved of raising children in some bubble that is different than reality and I actually think it can be dangerous. 
 
 
The people who publish porn and violence have a right to do just that. I have a right to think they are damaging society by pushing hedonism and exaltation of violent behavior on impressionable minds that may subsequently cause their owners to be influenced to do things they shouldn't. You couple a controlling, rebelious song with some mind altering drugs and you've got yourself a time bomb. 

 
 I don't actually disagree with any of this. However it is not the entertainment industry that is the problem. What led to the troubled young mind using drugs is. The fact that most people can hear that rebelious song and not react like a homocidal maniac indicates to me that they REAL problem is not the song.
 
 
...but can you say her nephew wasn't driven by The Who to take his own life? Are you aware somehow of what was going through his mind when he killed himself? Are you good at eliminating possible causes of suicidal tendencies and actions? Just because you can handle being exposed to something doesn't mean everybody else should be able to. It certainly does not imply an impossibility.

 
 I don't know - maybe her nephew really was that much of an idiot. A perfectly good, happy, healthy kid who heard a Who song and just decided to off himself. Maybe the gene pool is better off. Or maybe I can give him some credit and assume something far worse was going on. Maybe I can recognize not wanting to face the facts and scapegoating when I see it.
 
 
I'm not afraid of spiders. Some people are.

 
 Like me. And yet I am not inclined to ban them or claim they aren't insects.
jim's trucking

...(Speaking of spiders...)
 
 Like me. And yet I am not inclined to ban them or claim they aren't insects.
You should claim that they aren't insects because they're not...and that's not by my arrogant definition. Insects have 3 pairs of legs...spiders (arachnids) have 4 pairs.
 
 Let that be a lesson to you!emoticon_xhoho
jitobear

You should claim that they aren't insects because they're not...and that's not by my arrogant definition. Insects have 3 pairs of legs...spiders (arachnids) have 4 pairs.
 
 Let that be a lesson to you!emoticon_xhoho

 
 Fine - BUGS then. I don't think there is a minimum or maximum leg requirement for being a bug. :p
jim's trucking

Fine - BUGS then. I don't think there is a minimum or maximum leg requirement for being a bug. :p
Am I 'bugging' you?emoticon_xclown
 
 Actually, you've softened my view. I see too many websites wherein seemingly knowledgeable people list RAP/HIPHOP as a type of music to continue denying it qualifies as such.
 
 That doesn't change my opinion of its worth.
jitobear

Am I 'bugging' you?emoticon_xclown
 
 Actually, you've softened my view. I see too many websites wherein seemingly knowledgeable people list RAP/HIPHOP as a type of music to continue denying it qualifies as such.
 
 That doesn't change my opinion of its worth.

 
 And thats OK. There is plenty of music that makes me want to drive ice-picks into my ears. So, although we don't agree on what we like for music, I can empathize with what you mean.
chemist99a

Nor is rythem by itself not music.

 
 Even silence is sometimes considered musical!

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Is this where we're headed?
